channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Syria Violence Marked by Sectarian and Revenge Killings, War Monitor Says

item.title: U.S. Inflation Eased More Than Expected in February
item.description: Economists are bracing for intensifying price pressures and slower growth, posing a challenge for the Federal Reserve.

item.title: Bitcoin rebounds after a rosy inflation report—But there are storm clouds on the horizon
item.description: Inflation hit 2.8% in February, adding 0.2% instead of the 0.3% economists expected.

item.title: Egg Prices Surge Again Even as Inflation Eases

item.title: Binance nets biggest ever crypto investment as UAE-backed MGX puts in $2 billion
item.description: The investment came in the form of stablecoins and reflects the growing presence of crypto in the Middle East.

item.title: Inflation cooled in February, but economists say Trump’s tariffs haven’t had time to take effect

item.title: Separatists Are Still Holding Hundreds of Hostages in Pakistan Train Standoff
item.description: Security forces were trying to rescue passengers a day after Baloch ethnic fighters seized a train carrying more than 400 people.

item.title: Burnout is costing companies as much as $5 million a year—Here’s how that breaks down from average worker to top executive
item.description: Losses can range from $4,000 to over $20,000 per employee.

item.title: Zelensky Says Ukraine Showed ‘We Want a Fast Peace’
item.description: While Ukraine said it would agree to a 30-day cease-fire proposal, many in the country were skeptical about whether Russia would do the same.

item.title: Egg prices fall, Trump administration says, but perhaps only for a little while
item.description: Agriculture Secretary says prices have dropped by nearly $2 per dozen.
